chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 18, 1897, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 8, 1902, after confirmation.
The new Government of Russia was still unrecognized by the United States when Francis left Russia on November 7, 1918.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 15, 1934, after confirmation. Commissioned to the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics.

Commissioned to the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. The Government of the Soviet Union declared Kennan persona non grata on October 3, 1952, and he did not return to post.

Commissioned to the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. Continued to serve as Ambassador to the Russian Federation after the dissolution of the Soviet Union.
Proceeded to post, but was not officially received at court; left post in September 1783.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Did not proceed to post, his nomination having been rejected by the Senate while he was en route.
Did not proceed to post.
Proceeded to post, but did not present credentials; left post on September 19, 1830.
Declined appointment.
Not commissioned; nomination rejected by the Senate.
Not commissioned; nomination tabled by the Senate.
Not commissioned although nomination was confirmed by the Senate.
Not commissioned; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
Took oath of office, but died in the United States before proceeding to post.
Declined appointment.
